Stoic Six Pack : Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, Golden Sayings, Fragments and Discourses of Epictetus, Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion: ... Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion (Marcus Aurelius)
- La subrayado en la página 873 | posición 13377-13378 | Añadido el miércoles, 14 de diciembre de 2022 16:32:04

Of all existing things some are in our power, and others are not in our power.
==========
﻿Stoic Six Pack : Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, Golden Sayings, Fragments and Discourses of Epictetus, Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion: ... Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion (Marcus Aurelius)
- La subrayado en la página 873 | posición 13377-13379 | Añadido el miércoles, 14 de diciembre de 2022 16:32:42

Of all existing things some are in our power, and others are not in our power. In our power are thought, impulse, will to get and will to avoid, and, in a word, everything which is our own doing. Things not in our power include the body, property, reputation, office, and, in a word, everything which is not our own doing.
==========
﻿Stoic Six Pack : Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, Golden Sayings, Fragments and Discourses of Epictetus, Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion: ... Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion (Marcus Aurelius)
- La subrayado en la página 874 | posición 13395-13395 | Añadido el miércoles, 14 de diciembre de 2022 17:13:00

let your will to avoid have no concern with what is not in man's power; direct it only to things in man's power that are contrary to nature.
==========

- La subrayado en la página 874 | posición 13395-13396 | Añadido el miércoles, 14 de diciembre de 2022 17:16:03

let your will to avoid have no concern with what is not in man's power; direct it only to things in man's power that are contrary to nature. But for the moment you must utterly remove the will to get; for if you will to get something not in man's power you are bound to be unfortunate;
==========

﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 22 | posición 336-337 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:34:24

==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 26 | posición 393-401 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:40:37

Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement. Getting 1 percent better every day counts for a lot in the long-run. Habits are a double-edged sword. They can work for you or against you, which is why understanding the details is essential. Small changes often appear to make no difference until you cross a critical threshold. The most powerful outcomes of any compounding process are delayed. You need to be patient. An atomic habit is a little habit that is part of a larger system. Just as atoms are the building blocks of molecules, atomic habits are the building blocks of remarkable results. If you want better results, then forget about setting goals.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 26 | posición 393-401 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:40:54

Habits are the compound interest of self-improvement. Getting 1 percent better every day counts for a lot in the long-run. Habits are a double-edged sword. They can work for you or against you, which is why understanding the details is essential. Small changes often appear to make no difference until you cross a critical threshold. The most powerful outcomes of any compounding process are delayed. You need to be patient. An atomic habit is a little habit that is part of a larger system. Just as atoms are the building blocks of molecules, atomic habits are the building blocks of remarkable results. If you want better results, then forget about setting goals. Focus on your system instead.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 38 | posición 575-582 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:45:41

There are three levels of change: outcome change, process change, and identity change. The most effective way to change your habits is to focus not on what you want to achieve, but on who you wish to become. Your identity emerges out of your habits. Every action is a vote for the type of person you wish to become. Becoming the best version of yourself requires you to continuously edit your beliefs, and to upgrade and expand your identity. The real reason habits matter is not because they can get you better results (although they can do that), but because they can change your beliefs about yourself.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 38 | posición 577-582 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:45:53

The most effective way to change your habits is to focus not on what you want to achieve, but on who you wish to become. Your identity emerges out of your habits. Every action is a vote for the type of person you wish to become. Becoming the best version of yourself requires you to continuously edit your beliefs, and to upgrade and expand your identity. The real reason habits matter is not because they can get you better results (although they can do that), but because they can change your beliefs about yourself.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 31 | posición 470-473 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:46:22

The goal is not to read a book, the goal is to become a reader. The goal is not to run a marathon, the goal is to become a runner. The goal is not to learn an instrument, the goal is to become a musician.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 416 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:46:54


==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 418-423 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:47:20

The first layer is changing your outcomes. This level is concerned with changing your results: losing weight, publishing a book, winning a championship. Most of the goals you set are associated with this level of change. The second layer is changing your process. This level is concerned with changing your habits and systems: implementing a new routine at the gym, decluttering your desk for better workflow, developing a meditation practice. Most of the habits you build are associated with this level. The third and deepest layer is changing your identity. This level is concerned with changing your beliefs: your worldview, your self-image, your judgments about yourself and others.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 29 | posición 434-435 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:47:33

With outcome-based habits, the focus is on what you want to achieve. With identity-based habits, the focus is on who you wish to become.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 42 | posición 643-644 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:48:44

All habits proceed through four stages in the same order: cue, craving, response, and reward.
==========
﻿Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 51 | posición 774-779 | Añadido el jueves, 15 de diciembre de 2022 08:50:49

A habit is a behavior that has been repeated enough times to become automatic. The ultimate purpose of habits is to solve the problems of life with as little energy and effort as possible. Any habit can be broken down into a feedback loop that involves four steps: cue, craving, response, and reward. The Four Laws of Behavior Change are a simple set of rules we can use to build better habits. They are (1) make it obvious, (2) make it attractive, (3) make it easy, and (4) make it satisfying.
==========

﻿Stoic Six Pack : Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, Golden Sayings, Fragments and Discourses of Epictetus, Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion: ... Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion (Marcus Aurelius)
- La subrayado en la página 877 | posición 13446-13449 | Añadido el martes, 20 de diciembre de 2022 20:11:22

It is silly to want your children and your wife and your friends to live for ever, for that means that you want what is not in your control to be in your control, and what is not your own to be yours. In the same way if you want your servant to make no mistakes, you are a fool, for you want vice not to be vice but something different. But if you want not to be disappointed in your will to get, you can attain to that.
==========

Step seven: Resolve to do something

﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 18 | posición 264-264 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 19:42:34

Step seven: Resolve to do something every single day that moves you toward your major goal.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 18 | posición 276-283 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 19:43:54

1. Take a clean sheet of paper right now and make a list of ten goals you want to accomplish in the next year. Write your goals as though a year has already passed and they are now a reality. Use the present tense, positive voice, and first person singular so that they are immediately accepted by your subconscious mind. For example, you could write, “I earn x number of dollars per year by this date” or “I weigh x number of pounds by this date” or “I drive such and such a car by this date.” 2. Review your list of ten goals and select the one goal that, if you achieved it, would have the greatest positive impact on your life. Whatever that goal is, write it on a separate sheet of paper, set a deadline, make a plan, take action on your plan, and then do something every single day that moves you toward that goal. This exercise alone could change your life!
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 14 | posición 206-207 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:24:06

﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 20 | posición 293-295 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:38:27

The masculine error is to think that eventually things will be different in some fundamental way. They won’t. It never ends. As long as life continues, the creative challenge is to tussle, play, and make love with the present moment while giving your unique gift.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 20 | posición 299-302 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:41:24

Spend at least one hour a day doing whatever you simply love to do—what you deeply feel you need to do, in your heart—in spite of the daily duties that seem to constrain you. However, be forewarned: you may discover that you don’t, or can’t, do it; that in fact, your fantasy of your future life is simply a fantasy.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 20 | posición 304-306 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:41:54

As a first step, spend at least an hour today giving your fullest gift, whatever that is for today, so that when you go to sleep at night you know you couldn’t have lived your day with more courage, creativity, and giving.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 313-315 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:43:34

Practice love instead of trying to bring an end to the quality that bothers you. You can’t escape the tussle with the feminine. Learn to find humor in the unending emotional drama the feminine seems to enjoy so much. The love that you magnify may realign her behavior, but your effort to fix her and your frustration never will.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 317-319 | Añadido el jueves, 29 de diciembre de 2022 23:44:22

Men who have lived significant lives are men who never waited: not for money, security, ease, or women. Feel what you want to give most as a gift, to your woman and to the world, and do what you can to give it today. Every moment waited is a moment wasted, and each wasted moment degrades your clarity of purpose.

==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 25 | posición 376-379 | Añadido el viernes, 30 de diciembre de 2022 22:40:00

a fearful man who still leans into his fear, living at his edge and putting his gift out from there, is more trustworthy and more inspirational than a fearful man who hangs back in the comfort zone, unwilling to even experience his fear on a day to day level. A free man is free to acknowledge his fears, without hiding them, or hiding from them. Live with your lips pressed against your fears, kissing your fears, neither pulling back nor aggressively violating them.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 27 | posición 412-413 | Añadido el sábado, 31 de diciembre de 2022 10:53:46

==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 27 | posición 412-414 | Añadido el sábado, 31 de diciembre de 2022 10:53:56

If you choose to go with your woman’s suggestion even when deep in your heart you feel that another decision is more wise, you are, in effect, saying, “I don’t trust my own wisdom.” You are weakening yourself by telling yourself this.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 418-421 | Añadido el sábado, 31 de diciembre de 2022 10:54:26

However, if you listen to your woman, taking everything she says into account and making your own best decision, then you are acting in accordance with your core. You are saying, in effect, “My deepest wisdom is leading me to this decision. If I am wrong, I will learn from it, and my wisdom will have deepened. I’m willing to be wrong, and grow from it. I trust this process of acting from my deepest wisdom.”
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 421-423 | Añadido el sábado, 31 de diciembre de 2022 10:55:29

This attitude of self-trust engenders others’ trust in you. You may be wrong, but you are willing to find out, and thus grow from the experience. You are open to listening to others, but in the end, you will take the responsibility for making your own decision. There is nobody else to blame.
==========

﻿Stoic Six Pack : Meditations of Marcus Aurelius, Golden Sayings, Fragments and Discourses of Epictetus, Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion: ... Letters From a Stoic and the Enchiridion (Marcus Aurelius)
- La subrayado en la página 875 | posición 13408-13410 | Añadido el lunes, 2 de enero de 2023 11:12:25

What disturbs men's minds is not events but their judgements on events: For instance, death is nothing dreadful, or else Socrates would have thought it so. No, the only dreadful thing about it is men's judgement that it is dreadful.
==========

Always work from a list. When something new comes up, add it to the list before you do it.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 20 | posición 305-306 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:09:47

Make your list the night before for the workday ahead.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 311-312 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:11:57

First, you should create a master list on which you write down everything you can think of that you want to do sometime in the future.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 313-314 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:12:12

==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 315-315 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:12:29

Third, you should have a weekly list where you plan your entire week in advance.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 318-319 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:13:39

technique will work for you as well. Finally, you should transfer items from your monthly and weekly lists onto your daily list.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 21 | posición 318-319 | Añadido el lunes, 9 de enero de 2023 10:13:43

﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 34 | posición 509-510 | Añadido el miércoles, 18 de enero de 2023 10:55:19

If you are going to tryst with women and world at all, better to go all the way and ravish them from the depths of your true core, blooming them open with the wide gifts of your unrelenting heart.
==========
﻿The Way of the Superior Man (David Deida)
- La subrayado en la página 34 | posición 509-513 | Añadido el miércoles, 18 de enero de 2023 10:56:01

If you are going to tryst with women and world at all, better to go all the way and ravish them from the depths of your true core, blooming them open with the wide gifts of your unrelenting heart. Otherwise, if you sheepishly penetrate them to gratify your own needs, your woman and the world will feel your lack of dedication, depth, and truth. Rather than yielding in love to your loving, they will distract you, suck your energy, and draw you into endless complications, so that your life and relationship become an almost constant search for release from constraint.
==========
﻿The Go-Giver: A Little Story About a Powerful Business Idea (Bob Burg)

This is an excellent storytelling strategy: make your audience think they are on one path, and then when they least expect it, show them that they have been on a different path all along.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 153 | posición 2338-2338 | Añadido el jueves, 19 de enero de 2023 21:51:55

A Backpack is a strategy that increases the stakes of the story by increasing the audience’s anticipation about a coming event.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 155 | posición 2363-2363 | Añadido el jueves, 19 de enero de 2023 21:55:11

Backpacks are most effective when a plan does not work.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 155 | posición 2368-2370 | Añadido el jueves, 19 de enero de 2023 21:56:14

It’s struggle and strife that make stories great. They want to see their characters ultimately triumph, but they want suffering first. They don’t want anything to be easy. Perfect plans executed perfectly never make good stories.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 155 | posición 2372-2372 | Añadido el jueves, 19 de enero de 2023 21:57:12

Storytellers use Breadcrumbs when we hint at a future event but only reveal enough to keep the audience guessing.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 156 | posición 2386-2387 | Añadido el jueves, 19 de enero de 2023 21:58:47

Breadcrumbs are particularly effective when the truly unexpected is coming.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 22 | posición 324-325 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:10:34

When you have a project of any kind, begin by making a list of every step that you will have to complete to finish the project from beginning to end. Organize the steps by priority, what is most important, and sequence, which tasks you must complete in order.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 22 | posición 331-333 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:13:19

One of the most important rules of personal effectiveness is the 10/90 Rule. This rule says that the first 10 percent of time that you spend planning and organizing your work before you begin will save you as much as 90 percent of the time in getting the job done once you get started.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 26 | posición 388-390 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:20:31

“Your principles can’t be extinguished unless you snuff out the thoughts that feed them, for it’s continually in your power to reignite new ones. . . . It’s possible to start living again! See things anew as you once did—that is how to restart life!”
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 26 | posición 398-399 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:21:20

What happened yesterday—what happened five minutes ago—is the past. We can reignite and restart whenever we like. Why not do it right now?
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 24 | posición 358-360 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:28:26

most people procrastinate on the top 10 or 20 percent of items that are the most valuable and important, the “vital few.” They busy themselves instead with the least important 80 percent,
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 24 | posición 365-366 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:29:31

you must adamantly refuse to work on tasks in the bottom 80 percent while you still have tasks in the top 20 percent left to be done.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 24 | posición 366-367 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:29:54

Before you begin work, always ask yourself, “Is this task in the top 20 percent of my activities or in the bottom 80 percent?”
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 24 | posición 368-368 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:30:00

Rule: Resist the temptation to clear up small things first.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 25 | posición 370-371 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:30:26

Low-value tasks are like rabbits; they multiply continually. You never get caught up.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 25 | posición 375-376 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:31:08

the time required to complete an important job is often the same as the time required to do an unimportant job.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 25 | posición 375-377 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:31:31

the time required to complete an important job is often the same as the time required to do an unimportant job. The difference is that you get a tremendous feeling of pride and satisfaction from completing something valuable and significant.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 25 | posición 379-383 | Añadido el viernes, 20 de enero de 2023 21:32:16

Time management is taking control over what you do next. And you are always free to choose the task that you will do next. Your ability to choose between the important and the unimportant is the key determinant of your success in life and work. Effective, productive people discipline themselves to start on the most important task that is before them. They force themselves to eat that frog, whatever it is. As a result, they accomplish vastly more than the average person and are much happier as a result. This should be your way of working as well.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 159 | posición 2430-2430 | Añadido el domingo, 22 de enero de 2023 17:08:44

Find the moment in your story that everyone has been waiting for, then flip that Hourglass and let the sand run.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 159 | posición 2438-2439 | Añadido el domingo, 22 de enero de 2023 17:09:48

We use Crystal Balls in everyday life because we, as human beings, are all prediction machines. We are constantly trying to anticipate the future, so when telling stories, recounting those in-the-moment predictions is critical.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 160 | posición 2448-2449 | Añadido el domingo, 22 de enero de 2023 17:11:19

In storytelling, deploy Crystal Balls strategically: Only when your prediction seems possible. Only when your guess is reasonable. And only when your prediction presents an intriguing or exciting possibility.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 160 | posición 2451-2453 | Añadido el domingo, 22 de enero de 2023 17:11:49

Elephants, Backpacks, Breadcrumbs, Hourglasses, and Crystal Balls will only get you so far. If your story is boring, it will always be boring. But if your story has some potentially boring parts — sections that need to be told but simply aren’t compelling — these strategies will help a lot.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 162 | posición 2472-2474 | Añadido el domingo, 22 de enero de 2023 17:13:48

Stakes are essential in a story. Stakes are the gears that make stories work. If your story lacks stakes or lacks meaningful stakes, there is nothing you can do to make that story great. Humor is optional. Stakes are nonnegotiable.
==========

Successful people are those who are willing to delay gratification and make sacrifices in the short term so that they can enjoy far greater rewards in the long term.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 419-420 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:56:40

If a task or activity has large potential positive consequences, make it a top priority and get started on it immediately.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 419-421 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:56:57

If a task or activity has large potential positive consequences, make it a top priority and get started on it immediately. If something can have large potential negative consequences if it is not done quickly and well, that becomes a top priority as well. Whatever your frog is, resolve to gulp it down first thing.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 425-426 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:58:11

The time is going to pass anyway. The only question is how you use it and where you are going to end up at the end of the weeks and months that pass.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 28 | posición 430-431 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:58:28

==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 29 | posición 435-435 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:59:05

==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 29 | posición 439-440 | Añadido el sábado, 28 de enero de 2023 12:59:44

==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 36 | posición 537-538 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 13:54:19

A “B” item is defined as a task that you should do. But it has only mild consequences.
==========
﻿Eat That Frog! (Brian Tracy)
- La subrayado en la página 36 | posición 541-542 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 13:54:33

==========

The starting point of high performance is for you to identify the key result areas of your work. Discuss them with your boss. Make a list of your most important output responsibilities, and make sure that the people above you, on the same level as you, and below you are in agreement with it.

﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 175 | posición 2674-2675 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 14:20:26

Storytellers use assumption when there is a detail so important to the story that it must be stated with specificity,
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 176 | posición 2687-2688 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 14:22:04

A lie of progression is when a storyteller changes the order of events in a story to make it more emotionally satisfying or comprehensible to the listener.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 177 | posición 2708-2710 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 14:24:50

Storytellers use conflation to push all the emotion of an event into a single time frame, because stories are more entertaining this way. Rather than describing change over a long period, we compress all the intellectual and emotional transformation into a smaller bit of time, because this is what audiences expect from stories.
==========
﻿Storyworthy (Matthew Dicks)
- La subrayado en la página 179 | posición 2736-2738 | Añadido el lunes, 30 de enero de 2023 14:28:14

Conflation will also help you to keep your stories shorter, which is always a good thing. Shorter stories, onstage and in real life, are always more entertaining.
==========

﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 40 | posición 603-604 | Añadido el domingo, 5 de febrero de 2023 16:45:44

If there’s a central message of Stoic thought, it’s this: impulses of all kinds are going to come, and your work is to control them, like bringing a dog to heel.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 40 | posición 603-605 | Añadido el domingo, 5 de febrero de 2023 16:45:55

If there’s a central message of Stoic thought, it’s this: impulses of all kinds are going to come, and your work is to control them, like bringing a dog to heel. Put more simply: think before you act. Ask: Who is in control here? What principles are guiding me?
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La nota en la página 40 | posición 605 | Añadido el domingo, 5 de febrero de 2023 16:46:51

- La subrayado en la página 41 | posición 617-618 | Añadido el lunes, 6 de febrero de 2023 10:50:57

﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 42 | posición 630-631 | Añadido el martes, 7 de febrero de 2023 08:26:19

==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 42 | posición 639-641 | Añadido el miércoles, 8 de febrero de 2023 20:07:55

The next time you find yourself in the middle of a freakout, or moaning and groaning with flulike symptoms, or crying tears of regret, just ask: Is this actually making me feel better? Is this actually relieving any of the symptoms I wish were gone?
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 42 | posición 633-634 | Añadido el miércoles, 8 de febrero de 2023 20:08:04

“You cry, I’m suffering severe pain! Are you then relieved from feeling it, if you bear it in an unmanly way?”
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 42 | posición 636-638 | Añadido el miércoles, 8 de febrero de 2023 20:08:15

The next time someone gets upset near you—crying, yelling, breaking something, being pointed or cruel—watch how quickly this statement will stop them cold: “I hope this is making you feel better.”
==========
﻿El Imperio Final (Ed. ilustrada) (Brandon Sanderson)
- El marcador en la página 774 | posición 11868 | Añadido el miércoles, 8 de febrero de 2023 21:57:37

So yes, use Stoicism to manage these difficulties. But don’t forget to ask: Is this really the life I want? Every time you get upset, a little bit
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 45 | posición 689-690 | Añadido el domingo, 12 de febrero de 2023 08:23:40

don’t forget to ask: Is this really the life I want? Every time you get upset, a little bit of life leaves the body. Are these really the things on which you want to spend that priceless resource? Don’t be afraid to make a change—a big one.
==========
﻿El Imperio Final (Ed. ilustrada) (Brandon Sanderson)
- La subrayado en la página 94 | posición 1441-1443 | Añadido el domingo, 12 de febrero de 2023 13:52:42

﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 46 | posición 704-705 | Añadido el lunes, 13 de febrero de 2023 06:08:57

Once you understand that indulging might actually be worse than resisting, the urge begins to lose its appeal. In this way, self-control becomes the real pleasure, and the temptation becomes the regret.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 46 | posición 691-694 | Añadido el lunes, 13 de febrero de 2023 06:09:07

“Whenever you get an impression of some pleasure, as with any impression, guard yourself from being carried away by it, let it await your action, give yourself a pause. After that, bring to mind both times, first when you have enjoyed the pleasure and later when you will regret it and hate yourself. Then compare to those the joy and satisfaction you’d feel for abstaining altogether.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 47 | posición 714-715 | Añadido el martes, 14 de febrero de 2023 21:49:08

- La subrayado en la página 49 | posición 739-740 | Añadido el jueves, 16 de febrero de 2023 06:09:14

Life (and our job) is difficult enough. Let’s not make it harder by getting emotional about insignificant matters or digging in for battles we don’t actually care about.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 49 | posición 749-751 | Añadido el viernes, 17 de febrero de 2023 10:49:20

Locate that yearning for more, better, someday and see it for what it is: the enemy of your contentment. Choose it or your happiness. As Epictetus says, the two are not compatible.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 49 | posición 745-748 | Añadido el viernes, 17 de febrero de 2023 10:50:02

I’ll be happy when I graduate, we tell ourselves. I’ll be happy when I get this promotion, when this diet pays off, when I have the money that my parents never had. Conditional happiness is what psychologists call this kind of thinking. Like the horizon, you can walk for miles and miles and never reach it. You won’t even get any closer.
==========
﻿The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 50 | posición 763-764 | Añadido el sábado, 18 de febrero de 2023 17:11:29

As something being passed around comes to you, reach out your hand and take a moderate helping. Does it pass you by? Don’t stop it. It hasn’t yet come? Don’t burn in desire for it, but wait until it arrives in front of you.
==========
﻿El Imperio Final (Ed. ilustrada) (Brandon Sanderson)

“You shouldn’t give circumstances the power to rouse anger, for they don’t care at all.”
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 54 | posición 820-821 | Añadido el viernes, 24 de febrero de 2023 19:32:40

circumstances are incapable of considering or caring for your feelings, your anxiety, or your excitement.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 54 | posición 820-822 | Añadido el viernes, 24 de febrero de 2023 19:32:50

circumstances are incapable of considering or caring for your feelings, your anxiety, or your excitement. They don’t care about your reaction. They are not people. So stop acting like getting worked up is having an impact on a given situation. Situations don’t care at all.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 55 | posición 831-833 | Añadido el viernes, 24 de febrero de 2023 19:35:21

Our reaction is what actually decides whether harm has occurred. If we feel that we’ve been wronged and get angry, of course that’s how it will seem. If we raise our voice because we feel we’re being confronted, naturally a confrontation will ensue.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 54 | posición 824-824 | Añadido el viernes, 24 de febrero de 2023 19:35:33

So when someone arouses your anger, know that it’s really your own opinion fueling it.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 55 | posición 842-843 | Añadido el domingo, 26 de febrero de 2023 13:50:20

no matter how much he conquered, no matter how much he inflicted his will on the world, it would be like building a castle in the sand—soon to be erased by the winds of time.

The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 56 | posición 845-846 | Añadido el domingo, 26 de febrero de 2023 13:50:53

==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 57 | posición 861-864 | Añadido el lunes, 27 de febrero de 2023 07:52:16

Imagine the power you’d have in your life and relationships if all the things that trouble everyone else—how thin they are, how much money they have, how long they have left to live, how they will die—didn’t matter so much. What if, where others were upset, envious, excited, possessive, or greedy, you were objective, calm, and clearheaded? Can you envision that? Imagine what it would do for your relationships at work, or for your love life, or your friendships.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 57 | posición 861-863 | Añadido el lunes, 27 de febrero de 2023 07:54:11

Imagine the power you’d have in your life and relationships if all the things that trouble everyone else—how thin they are, how much money they have, how long they have left to live, how they will die—didn’t matter so much.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 57 | posición 870-873 | Añadido el martes, 28 de febrero de 2023 08:40:39

“The soul is like a bowl of water, and our impressions are like the ray of light falling upon the water. When the water is troubled, it appears that the light itself is moved too, but it isn’t. So, when a person loses their composure it isn’t their skills and virtues that are troubled, but the spirit in which they exist, and when that spirit calms down so do those things.”
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 58 | posición 887-889 | Añadido el miércoles, 1 de marzo de 2023 07:24:00

“Don’t set your heart on so many things,” says Epictetus. Focus. Prioritize. Train your mind to ask: Do I need this thing? What will happen if I do not get it? Can I make do without it? The answers to these questions will help you relax, help you cut out all the needless things that make you busy—too busy to be balanced or happy.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 60 | posición 913-915 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 05:55:57

We underestimate our capabilities just as much and just as dangerously as we overestimate other abilities. Cultivate the ability to judge yourself accurately and honestly. Look inward to discern what you’re capable of and what it will take to unlock that potential.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 60 | posición 908-908 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 05:56:09

Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 187 | posición 2854-2856 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:38:47

The Goldilocks Rule states that humans experience peak motivation when working on tasks that are right on the edge of their current abilities. Not too hard. Not too easy. Just right.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 187 | posición 2862-2864 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:39:51

When you’re starting a new habit, it’s important to keep the behavior as easy as possible so you can stick with it even when conditions aren’t perfect.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 187 | posición 2864-2866 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:40:32

Once a habit has been established, however, it’s important to continue to advance in small ways. These little improvements and new challenges keep you engaged. And if you hit the Goldilocks Zone just right, you can achieve a flow state.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 187 | posición 2864-2867 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:40:42

Once a habit has been established, however, it’s important to continue to advance in small ways. These little improvements and new challenges keep you engaged. And if you hit the Goldilocks Zone just right, you can achieve a flow state.* A flow state is the experience of being “in the zone” and fully immersed in an activity.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 188 | posición 2870-2871 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:41:42

Improvement requires a delicate balance. You need to regularly search for challenges that push you to your edge while continuing to make enough progress to stay motivated.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 188 | posición 2870-2872 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:42:22

Improvement requires a delicate balance. You need to regularly search for challenges that push you to your edge while continuing to make enough progress to stay motivated. Behaviors need to remain novel in order for them to stay attractive and satisfying.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)

- La subrayado en la página 188 | posición 2882-2883 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:43:40

successful people feel the same lack of motivation as everyone else.

- La subrayado en la página 188 | posición 2882-2883 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:43:46

successful people feel the same lack of motivation as everyone else. The difference is that they still find a way to show up despite the feelings of boredom.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 188 | posición 2882-2884 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:43:59

successful people feel the same lack of motivation as everyone else. The difference is that they still find a way to show up despite the feelings of boredom. Mastery requires practice. But the more you practice something, the more boring and routine it becomes.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 189 | posición 2887-2887 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:44:34

The greatest threat to success is not failure but boredom.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 189 | posición 2891-2892 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:45:07

“Men desire novelty to such an extent that those who are doing well wish for a change as much as those who are doing badly.”
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 190 | posición 2899-2900 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:47:45

The sweet spot of desire occurs at a 50/50 split between success and failure. Half of the time you get what you want. Half of the time you don’t. You need just enough “winning” to experience satisfaction and just enough “wanting” to experience desire.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 190 | posición 2906-2906 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:48:47

you have to fall in love with boredom.

Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 190 | posición 2912-2914 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:49:31

Professionals stick to the schedule; amateurs let life get in the way. Professionals know what is important to them and work toward it with purpose; amateurs get pulled off course by the urgencies of life.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 191 | posición 2915-2916 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:49:52

==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 191 | posición 2920-2921 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:50:16

The only way to become excellent is to be endlessly fascinated by doing the same thing over and over. You have to fall in love with boredom.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 191 | posición 2922-2928 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 12:50:27

The Goldilocks Rule states that humans experience peak motivation when working on tasks that are right on the edge of their current abilities. The greatest threat to success is not failure but boredom. As habits become routine, they become less interesting and less satisfying. We get bored. Anyone can work hard when they feel motivated. It’s the ability to keep going when work isn’t exciting that makes the difference. Professionals stick to the schedule; amateurs let life get in the way.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 192 | posición 2935-2937 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 16:35:37

the benefits of habits come at a cost. At first, each repetition develops fluency, speed, and skill. But then, as a habit becomes automatic, you become less sensitive to feedback. You fall into mindless repetition. It becomes easier to let mistakes slide.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 192 | posición 2935-2938 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 16:35:45

the benefits of habits come at a cost. At first, each repetition develops fluency, speed, and skill. But then, as a habit becomes automatic, you become less sensitive to feedback. You fall into mindless repetition. It becomes easier to let mistakes slide. When you can do it “good enough” on autopilot, you stop thinking about how to do it better.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 192 | posición 2938-2939 | Añadido el jueves, 2 de marzo de 2023 16:36:00

The upside of habits is that we can do things without thinking. The downside of habits is that you get used to doing things a certain way and stop paying attention to little errors.
==========

Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)

Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 200 | posición 3063-3069 | Añadido el viernes, 3 de marzo de 2023 07:48:09

Men are born soft and supple; dead, they are stiff and hard. Plants are born tender and pliant; dead, they are brittle and dry. Thus whoever is stiff and inflexible is a disciple of death. Whoever is soft and yielding is a disciple of life. The hard and stiff will be broken. The soft and supple will prevail. —LAO TZU
==========

- La subrayado en la página 204 | posición 3116-3116 | Añadido el viernes, 3 de marzo de 2023 08:13:14

The secret to getting results that last is to never stop making improvements.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)
- La subrayado en la página 204 | posición 3116-3119 | Añadido el viernes, 3 de marzo de 2023 08:13:38

The secret to getting results that last is to never stop making improvements. It’s remarkable what you can build if you just don’t stop. It’s remarkable the business you can build if you don’t stop working. It’s remarkable the body you can build if you don’t stop training. It’s remarkable the knowledge you can build if you don’t stop learning. It’s remarkable the fortune you can build if you don’t stop saving. It’s remarkable the friendships you can build if you don’t stop caring. Small habits don’t add up. They compound.
==========
Atomic Habits: Tiny Changes, Remarkable Results: An Easy & Proven Way to Build Good Habits & Break Bad Ones (James Clear)

“Wherever you go, there you are.” We can find a retreat at any time by looking inward.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 75 | posición 1136-1138 | Añadido el viernes, 24 de marzo de 2023 14:56:30

“Wherever you go, there you are.” We can find a retreat at any time by looking inward. We can sit with our eyes closed and feel our breath go in and out. We can turn on some music and tune out the world. We can turn off technology or shut off those rampant thoughts in our head. That will provide us peace. Nothing else.
==========

- La subrayado en la página 37 | posición 562-566 | Añadido el martes, 4 de abril de 2023 11:50:25

man must be prepared to give 100 percent to his purpose, fulfill his karma or dissolve it, and then let go of that specific form of living. He must be capable of not knowing what to do with his life, entering a period of unknowingness and waiting for a vision or a new form of purpose to emerge. These cycles of strong specific action followed by periods of not knowing what the hell is going on are natural for a man who is shedding layers of karma in his relaxation into truth.
==========

“When you let your attention slide for a bit, don’t think you will get back a grip on it whenever you wish—instead, bear in mind that because of today’s mistake everything that follows will be necessarily worse. . . .
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 98 | posición 1502-1503 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:53:50

Part of what Epictetus is saying here is that attention is a habit, and that letting your attention slip and wander builds bad habits and enables mistakes.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 98 | posición 1502-1503 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:54:04

Part of what Epictetus is saying here is that attention is a habit, and that letting your attention slip and wander builds bad habits and enables mistakes.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 98 | posición 1502-1505 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:54:11

Part of what Epictetus is saying here is that attention is a habit, and that letting your attention slip and wander builds bad habits and enables mistakes. You’ll never complete all your tasks if you allow yourself to be distracted with every tiny interruption. Your attention is one of your most critical resources. Don’t squander it!
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 99 | posición 1506-1507 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:55:40

“These are the characteristics of the rational soul: self-awareness, self-examination, and self-determination.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 99 | posición 1510-1512 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:56:01

First, we must look inward. Next, we must examine ourselves critically. Finally, we must make our own decisions—uninhibited by biases or popular notions.
==========
The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 99 | posición 1513-1514 | Añadido el miércoles, 3 de mayo de 2023 10:56:32

The Daily Stoic (Holiday, Ryan;Hanselman, Stephen)
- La subrayado en la página 115 | posición 1749-1751 | Añadido el domingo, 14 de mayo de 2023 09:03:36

Our ambition should not be to win, then, but to play with our full effort. Our intention is not to be thanked or recognized, but to help and to do what we think is right. Our focus is not on what happens to us but on how we respond. In this, we will always find contentment and resilience.
==========
